elements.title: Mechanism for local attenuation of DNA replication at double-strand breaks (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Mechanism for local attenuation of DNA replication at double-strand breaks

DNA double-strand breaks induce local genome maintenance and inhibition of replication initiation at nearby topologically associating domains without affecting global DNA synthesis.

  • Robin Sebastian
  • Eric G. Sun
  • Mirit I. Aladjem
Article19 Feb 2025

elements.title: Clonal driver neoantigen loss under EGFR TKI and immune selection pressures (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Clonal driver neoantigen loss under EGFR TKI and immune selection pressures

We show the evolution of a case of EGFR mutant lung cancer treated with a combination of erlotinib, osimertinib, radiotherapy and a personalized neopeptide vaccine targeting somatic mutations, including EGFR exon 19 deletion.

  • Maise Al Bakir
  • James L. Reading
  • Charles Swanton
ArticleOpen Access19 Feb 2025

elements.title: World and Human Action Models towards gameplay ideation (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
World and Human Action Models towards gameplay ideation

A state-of-the-art generative artificial intelligence model of a video game is introduced to allow the support of human creative ideation, with the analysis of user study data highlighting three necessary capabilities, namely, consistency, diversity and persistency.

  • Anssi Kanervisto
  • Dave Bignell
  • Katja Hofmann
ArticleOpen Access19 Feb 2025

elements.title: RNA neoantigen vaccines prime long-lived CD8+ T cells in pancreatic cancer (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
RNA neoantigen vaccines prime long-lived CD8+ T cells in pancreatic cancer

In a phase 1 trial, patients with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma who were treated with surgery and bespoke neoantigen mRNA vaccines combined with anti-PD-L1 and chemotherapy exhibited marked long-lived persistence of neoantigen-specific CD8+ T cell clones, which correlated with prolonged recurrence-free survival at a 3.2-year follow-up.

  • Zachary Sethna
  • Pablo Guasp
  • Vinod P. Balachandran
ArticleOpen Access19 Feb 2025

elements.title: De novo design of transmembrane fluorescence-activating proteins (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
De novo design of transmembrane fluorescence-activating proteins

A study describes the design of de novo ligand-binding transmembrane proteins, demonstrating their specific binding and activation of fluorogenic ligands.

  • Jingyi Zhu
  • Mingfu Liang
  • Peilong Lu
Article19 Feb 2025

elements.title: GABAergic neuron-to-glioma synapses in diffuse midline gliomas (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
GABAergic neuron-to-glioma synapses in diffuse midline gliomas

Functional, tumour-promoting GABAergic neuron-to-glioma synapses in diffuse midline gliomas are identified.

  • Tara Barron
  • Belgin YalÃ§Ä±n
  • Michelle Monje
ArticleOpen Access19 Feb 2025

elements.title: Nociceptive neurons promote gastric tumour progression via a CGRPâRAMP1 axis (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Nociceptive neurons promote gastric tumour progression via a CGRPâRAMP1 axis

Functional connectivity between gastric cancer cells and sensory neurons offers a potential therapeutic target.

  • Xiaofei Zhi
  • Feijing Wu
  • Timothy C. Wang
Article19 Feb 2025

elements.title: Thermal Ca2+/Mg2+ exchange reactions to synthesize CO2 removal materials (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Thermal Ca2+/Mg2+ exchange reactions to synthesize CO2 removal materials

Reactions of Mg-rich silicates with calcium carbonates/sulfates result in the formation of materials that could potentially be used for low-cost carbon dioxide removal from the atmosphere.

  • Yuxuan Chen
  • Matthew W. Kanan
Article19 Feb 2025

elements.title: Modulated ringdown comb interferometry for sensing of highly complex gases (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Modulated ringdown comb interferometry for sensing of highly complex gases

A new optical technique, modulated ringdown comb interferometry, is introduced for measuring the concentration of gas species in a complex sample and its efficacy demonstrated using exhaled human breath and ambient air in the mid-infrared.

  • Qizhong Liang
  • Apoorva Bisht
  • Jun Ye
Article19 Feb 2025

elements.title: Perovskite heteroepitaxy for high-efficiency and stable pure-red LEDs (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Perovskite heteroepitaxy for high-efficiency and stable pure-red LEDs

A heteroepitaxial-strain-based strategy for enhancing the stability of perovskite quantum dots for spectrally narrow (pure) red LEDs is reported.

  • Keyu Wei
  • Tong Zhou
  • Mingjian Yuan
Article19 Feb 2025

elements.title: Global modules robustly emerge from local interactions and smooth gradients (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Global modules robustly emerge from local interactions and smooth gradients

The principle of peak selection is described, by which local interactions and smooth gradients drive self-organization of discrete global modules.

  • Mikail Khona
  • Sarthak Chandra
  • Ila Fiete
Article19 Feb 2025

elements.title: SPO11 dimers are sufficient to catalyse DNA double-strand breaks in vitro (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
SPO11 dimers are sufficient to catalyse DNA double-strand breaks in vitro

A biochemical system recapitulates the hallmarks of meiotic double-strand break formation, with mouse SPO11 catalysing break formation in the absence of any partners and remaining covalently attached to 5â²âbroken strands.

  • CÃ©dric Oger
  • Corentin Claeys Bouuaert
ArticleOpen Access19 Feb 2025

elements.title: Interferometric single-shot parity measurement in InAsâAl hybrid devices (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Interferometric single-shot parity measurement in InAsâAl hybrid devices

A device architecture based on indium arsenideâaluminium heterostructures with a gate-defined superconducting nanowire allows single-shot interferometric measurement of fermion parity and demonstrates an assignment error probability of 1%.

  • Morteza Aghaee
  • Alejandro Alcaraz Ramirez
  • Justin Zilke
ArticleOpen Access19 Feb 2025

elements.contents:
In vitro reconstitution of meiotic DNA double-strand-break formation

The in vitro characterization of a key event in the early stages of meiosisâthe induction of double-strand DNA breaks by the SPO11âTOP6BL complexâprovides insight into the catalytic mechanism and evolution of SPO11.

elements.title: Reconstitution of SPO11-dependent double-strand break formation (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Reconstitution of SPO11-dependent double-strand break formation

Reconstitution of recombinantly expressed SPO11âTOP6BL complex recapitulates its DNA cleavage function and together with structural modelling and biochemical experiments, provides insights into the regulation and mechanism of SPO11 activity.
